entries.detail:
1→# Update HTTP Links to HTTPS for Security
     2→
     3→## Overview
     4→
     5→Convert all external HTTP links to HTTPS and add proper security attributes
     6→
     7→## Rationale
     8→
     9→Multiple external links use insecure HTTP protocol instead of HTTPS, which can trigger browser security warnings and appears unprofessional to tech-savvy recruiters
    10→
    11→---
    12→*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

entries.content: I see that subtask 1.5 is already marked as completed in the plan. Let me verify the current state of the file to see if the work has actually been done.

entries.detail:
570→ src="./images/profile.jpg" 571→ alt="Abe Diaz" 572→ class="profile-image" 573→ loading="lazy" 574→ > 575→ 576→

Sr. Technical Program Manager on the Disaster Relief by Amazon team. Born and raised in Puerto Rico; holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the UPR-Mayaguez and a MS in Information Security from Lipscomb University. Worked on mobile technologies for several years including at Deloitte building an enterprise app marketplace with over 40 apps and iPad applications for the top leaders in the company including the CEO. Later joined NBC News as the mobile program manager before joining Amazon. At Amazon I worked on payments, royalties and revenue automation for Prime Video. In 2017 I had the chance to participate as a technical volunteer in filling a plane with relief items for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Being able to mobilize the technology, people and resources of Amazon for a cause like this was "the experience of a lifetime". After that volunteer opportunity I decided to join the Disaster Relief by Amazon team permanently and I'm now in charge of our corporate in-kind donations and mobile disaster pickup points program.

577→ 578→

If you are interested in connecting professionally check out my LinkedIn page https://linkedin.com/in/abediaz. If you prefer pictures follow me on Instagram https://instagram.com/abe238 or Twitter https://twitter.com/abe238.

579→ 580→

Likes: Traveling (see stats below), Cider, RaspberryPis, Ice Baths and Contrast Showers

581→ 582→ 588→ 589→ Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed subtask 3.1. Here's what was accomplished:

## ✅ Subtask 3.1 Complete

**Changes Made:**
- Added `target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"` to all 11 external links on lines 576-580 in index.html

**Links Updated:**
1. UPR-Mayaguez (line 576)
2. Seattle Times article (line 576)
3. Amazon Disaster Relief (line 576)
4. LinkedIn (line 578)
5. Instagram (line 578)
6. Twitter (line 578)
7. JetItUp stats (line 580)
8. Locust Cider (line 580)
9. RaspberryPi (line 580)
10. Ice Baths Wikipedia (line 580)
11. Contrast Showers (line 580)

**Security Benefits:**
- `target="_blank"` - Opens external links in new tabs for better UX
- `rel="noopener noreferrer"` - Prevents tabnabbing attacks and removes referrer information

**Status:**
- ✅ All external links now have proper security attributes
- ✅ Changes committed successfully
- ✅ Implementation plan updated

The next subtask (3.2) will add the same security attributes to the footer external links on lines 596-597.
I'll help you implement this subtask. Let me start by reading the spec and implementation plan to understand the context.

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 3.2 Completed Successfully!

I've successfully added security attributes to the footer links on lines 596-597 of index.html.

### Changes Made:
- **Line 596 (LinkedIn)**: Added `target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"`
- **Line 597 (Twitter)**: Added `target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"`

### Security Benefits:
1. **`target="_blank"`**: Opens external links in a new tab for better user experience
2. **`rel="noopener noreferrer"`**: Prevents tabnabbing attacks and improves security by:
   - `noopener`: Prevents the new page from accessing the `window.opener` property
   - `noreferrer`: Prevents the browser from sending the Referer header to the external site

### Verification:
✅ Both footer links now have proper security attributes  
✅ Links still use HTTPS protocol  
✅ HTML structure is valid  
✅ Changes committed with descriptive message  
✅ Implementation plan updated to mark subtask as completed  

The footer links are now secure and follow best practices for external link handling!
I'll help you verify that no http:// links remain in the codebase. Let me start by getting the session context and then running a comprehensive search.
Now let me run a comprehensive search for any remaining http:// links in the codebase:

entries.content: Now let me read the index.html file to verify all link tags are properly formed:

entries.detail:
570→ src="./images/profile.jpg" 571→ alt="Abe Diaz" 572→ class="profile-image" 573→ loading="lazy" 574→ > 575→ 576→

Sr. Technical Program Manager on the Disaster Relief by Amazon team. Born and raised in Puerto Rico; holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the UPR-Mayaguez and a MS in Information Security from Lipscomb University. Worked on mobile technologies for several years including at Deloitte building an enterprise app marketplace with over 40 apps and iPad applications for the top leaders in the company including the CEO. Later joined NBC News as the mobile program manager before joining Amazon. At Amazon I worked on payments, royalties and revenue automation for Prime Video. In 2017 I had the chance to participate as a technical volunteer in filling a plane with relief items for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Being able to mobilize the technology, people and resources of Amazon for a cause like this was "the experience of a lifetime". After that volunteer opportunity I decided to join the Disaster Relief by Amazon team permanently and I'm now in charge of our corporate in-kind donations and mobile disaster pickup points program.

577→ 578→

If you are interested in connecting professionally check out my LinkedIn page https://linkedin.com/in/abediaz. If you prefer pictures follow me on Instagram https://instagram.com/abe238 or Twitter https://twitter.com/abe238.

579→ 580→

Likes: Traveling (see stats below), Cider, RaspberryPis, Ice Baths and Contrast Showers

581→ 582→ 588→ 589→ 590→ 591→ 592→ 593→
594→
